Detailed Description

Describes a graphical item.

typedef uint32 GfxFeature::SizeType

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum GfxFeature::gfxFeatureType
 

The types of features.

Enumeration values:
STREET_MAIN  Main class road.
STREET_FIRST  First class road.
STREET_SECOND  Second class road.
STREET_THIRD  Third class road.
STREET_FOURTH  Fourth class road.
BUILTUP_AREA  Builtup area.
PARK  Park (cityPark).
FOREST  Forest.
BUILDING  General building.
WATER  Water.
ISLAND  Island.
PEDESTRIANAREA  Pedestrian area.
AIRCRAFTROAD  Aircraft road.
LAND  Land.
BUILTUP_AREA_SQUARE  Builtup area, square-symbol.
BUILTUP_AREA_SMALL  Builtup area, small symbol.
WATER_LINE  Water represented as a line.
FERRY  Ferry.
RAILWAY  Railway.
INDIVIDUALBUILDING  Individual building items.
NATIONALPARK  Park (nationalPark).
OCEAN  Ocean (water below land).
BORDER  Country border.
AIRPORTGROUND  Airport item.
CARTOGRAPHIC_GREEN_AREA  Contains some cartographic types, that are considered to be green areas, similar to park items, where you can sit down and have "picnic".
CARTOGRAPHIC_GROUND  Most cartographic types = "all other types", that are not included in any specific cartographic feature type (like the green area).
ROUTE  ROUTE.

This indicates that the start of a new routesegment. Necessary to know if a certain routesegment should be highlighted.

ROUTE_CONTINUATION  ROUTE_CONTINUATION.

Continuation of a route, ie. this feature does not indicate the start of a new routesegment. It is simply a continuation of a previous ROUTE feature. Necessary to know in order to higlight a specific route segment.

PARK_CAR  PARK CAR, and walk.
EMPTY  EMPTY.
SYMBOL  SYMBOL.
TRAFFIC_INFO  Traffic Info.
ROUTE_ORIGIN  ROUTE_ORIGIN.
ROUTE_DESTINATION  ROUTE_DESTINATION.
POI  PointOfInterest.
EVENT  Event.
WALKWAY  Walkway.
WATER_IN_PARK  Water in park, same as water but drawn after park.
ISLAND_IN_BUA  Island in bua, same as island but with the bua color.
ISLAND_IN_WATER_IN_PARK  Island in water in park, same as island but with park color.
ISLAND_IN_WATER_IN_PARK_BUA  Island in water in park in BUA, same as island but with BUA color.
ISLAND_IN_WATER_IN_PARK_ISLAND  Island in water in park outside BUA, same as island.
BUA_ON_ISLAND  BUA on island.
NBR_GFXFEATURES  The number of feature-types.

Member Function Documentation

void GfxFeature::addCoordinateToLast (  int32  lat,
int32  lon,
int32  prevLat,
int32  prevLon
) 
 

Add new coordinates to the last polygon.

O(1) complexity regardless of the internal representation of the coordinates. Prefer this method to addCoordinate( int32 lat, int32 lon ).

Parameters:
lat Latitude to add.
lon Longitude to add.
prevLat Previous latitude. Ignored if no previous coordinates exist.
prevLon Previous longitude. Ignored if no previous coordinates exist.

void GfxFeature::addCoordinateToLast (  const MC2Coordinate &  coord  )  [inline]
 

above

Definition at line 299 of file GfxFeature.h.

References addCoordinateToLast(), coord, MC2Coordinate::lat, and MC2Coordinate::lon.

void GfxFeature::addCoordinateToLast (  int32  lat,
int32  lon
) 
 

Add new coordinates without specifying the previous ones.

O(1) complexity if the coordinates internally are represented by by absolute coordinates. O(n) complexity if the coordinates internally are represented by relative coordinates. n is the number of coordinates added so far. Use with care! Rather use the other version of addCoordinate().

Parameters:
lat Latitude to add.
lon Longitude to add.

Referenced by addCoordinateToLast().

uint32  startSize = 16

Member Data Documentation

MC2String GfxFeature::m_basename [private]
 

Basename is used for T-tiles when filtering and merging streets.

This contains the same name as the G-tiles name. This is because some streets might have mismatching names between languages. For example in taiwan there were two street items that had the same name in english but two different names in chinese which caused CRC-mismatch between T- and G-tiles.

Definition at line 532 of file GfxFeature.h.

Referenced by setBasename().

Definition at line 486 of file GfxFeature.h.

Referenced by setDisplayText().

int GfxFeature::m_drawTextStart [protected]
 

HACK:.

When tilemaps are generated, this member will be used to store the language type (16 lower bits), as well as if the name is already abbreviated (MSB).

The angle of the text, in degrees, or if negative it indicates the text to follow the polygon at index (-drawTextStart)+1, ei. -1 is index 0.

Definition at line 518 of file GfxFeature.h.

Referenced by getLangType(), getNameIsAbbreviated(), setDrawTextStart(), and setLangType().
